page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The D-area is predominantly farmland,rough grazing and moorland,with one village,one hamlet and four farms. The A68,a main road from Edinburgh to Newcastle,runs for approximately 4 kms in a NW-SE direction.A B-class road joins the A68 to the A7. The altitude of the area is between 600 and 800 ft rising in a southerly direction to the outliers of the Lammermuirs at Soutra Hill. Several small burns,all tributaries of the R.Tyne,which enters the river Forth at Tyninghame,run through the area. In the more easterly sections of this area the land is wooded,and in recent years there has been considerable felling and replanting of coniferous trees.
